title: What is more likely to be true naturalism or there being a god? - Quora

response.answer_text: This is a false duality. Modern naturalism has a host of issues, as documented in the following books: Uncommon Dissent: Intellectuals Who Find Darwinism Unconvincing, William Dembski - Amazon.com Illogical Atheism: A Comprehensive Response to the Contemporary Freethinker from a Lapsed Agnostic - Kindle edition by Bo Jinn, Diogo Lando. Naturalism these days lays on the boundary of scientism. “There being a god” is also a failed premise, since all names and forms are diminished anthropomorphic representations of undifferentiated consciousness. Find your way to Advaita Vedanta, and you can see a Logical Religion. Don’t confuse “god” with religion or religion with “god”. God is a poorly defined word that is very nearly a weasel word at this point. The primary thing is to learn how to balance being open and being discriminative. You have two parts of your mind- one literally cannot see ANY differences, and the other cannot see anything unitive. Your job is to learn to balance these perspectives by learning how your mind works. Those who subscribe to modern scientism/naturalism are highly imbalanced and biased- and their bias is nearly identical to that of fundamentalist religions also. Crucially, ego and ignorance are the main issues here, in all walks of life. So, in the future, a better question would be: “How do I avoid ego (projections) and ignorance (the psychological shadow) when I look to any given topic (in this case, spiritual inquiry)?” Try not to be fooled by such false dualities, and the surface qualities our society is nearly obsessed with. Look deeper, and look within. Find a teacher who will allow you to learn about the nature of your own mind’s ‘lensing’ of the nature of reality, and you’ll know the answer to you own question.

Truth is a property of propositions. Being true means something like ‘this proposition reflects the state of affairs in the real world’. Given this, it’s not hard to see which method is more likely to produce true propositions: Actually looking at the real world.Looking at an evidence-free imaginary world which you would like to be true.Identifying which one it is, I leave as an exercise for the reader.

We live in the natural world - we can’t breathe water of chlorine gas, we have to eat to stay alive, etc. There’s absolutely zero objective evidence that any god has ever existed. So what is is a lot more likely than what probably isn’t. (There’s nothing objectively “true” or “false” in your assertions - just likelihoods.)

To my naive way of looking at this it’s naturalism all the way. The god answer has a long history of being incorrect. It was incorrect about the causes of lightning and thunder, about tides, about earthquakes and volcanos and storms and countless other things. On the other hand science and naturalism has runs on the board in inverse proportion perhaps to the failures of the god explanation. To me the god explanation is so discredited that it has become ridiculous. It is nothing more than guesswork with the imprimatur of tradition.
God may be what is natural while everything physical is the supernatural illusion. From nothing -BANG - everything ? The most natural result from nothing would be nothing.

If you believe in Naturalism or Deism there is no difference If you reject the illusion of purpose and apply scientific rules of logic without prejudice then the proofs cannot have a common ground. The question includes contradictory assumptions.
I can’t prove to you on a message board that God exists. You want answers to the big questions? Read my book, Evidence of Falsehood: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01M3MMP66
How would we measure the likeliness? This question is unanswerable until we have a unit by which we measure the ideas in question.
